venue.name: Maynard Ecology Center , Neville Place basement

item.description: THE MOON: FACT, FICTION, AND LORE 7 to 9 pm Astronomer Joshua Roth and naturalist Barbara Strell will lead activities addressing everything from the moon's origin to its effects on human behavior. They will also offer moon-watching tips and (weather permitting) a chance to view the moon with a variety of optical instruments. This program will run even if it’s cloudy but cancels if rain is heavy. Dress warmly, in layers, and be prepared to spend some time outdoors. Registration required! E-mail Elizabeth Wylde at friendsoffreshpond@yahoo.com or call 617-349-6489 and leave your name and phone number.
item.name: THE MOON: FACT, FICTION, AND LORE
